# step 1 -- get all wanted variables from different data set
```{r}
#sort the data
### get data1
rawdata <- read.csv(file = 'C:/Users/timothy/Documents/GWAS_data/dairy/IGF1data.csv')
data <- rawdata %>%
  select(ID, APOE4_status, family_history_AD, Sex, Age_Baseline, age1of3groups, SmokingY08, AlcoholY08, BMI_Y08andY12andY14_mean, rsfMRI_Component1, rsfMRI_Component5, rsfMRI_Component7, rsfMRI_Component9, rsfMRI_Component13, rsfMRI_Component14, rsfMRI_Component20)
#data1 includes fMRI, sex, age, AOPE4, smoking, alcohol, family history, and BMI
rm(rawdata)
write.csv(data, "C:\\Users\\timothy\\Documents\\GWAS_data\\dairy\\data1.csv", row.names=FALSE)
rm(list = ls())
```

```{r}
### get data3 -- cheese intake, Red wine intake, cheese type, milk type
rawdata <- read.csv(file = 'C:/Users/timothy/Documents/GWAS_data/dairy/UKBiobank_Masterfile.csv')


data <- rawdata %>%
  select(eid, 1408-0.0, 1408-1.0, 1408-2.0, 1418-0.0, 1418-1.0, 1418-2.0)
#data1 includes sex, age, AOPE4, TOMM40, family history

write.csv(data, "C:\\Users\\timothy\\Documents\\GWAS_data\\dairy\\data3.csv", row.names=FALSE)

# Change colnames of some columns
colnames(data)[colnames(data) %in% c("1408-0.0", "1408-1.0","1408-2.0")] <- c("CheeseIntake_baseline", "CheeseIntake_1repear", "CheeseIntake_ImagingVisit")
colnames(data)[colnames(data) %in% c("1418-0.0", "1418-1.0","1418-2.0")] <- c("MilkType_baseline", "MilkType_1repear", "MilkType_ImagingVisit")
```
